alert.note: Alert for Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 2:15PM CDT until May 06 at 3:37PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, northwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Kingfisher. In northwest Oklahoma, Blaine and Dewey. In western Oklahoma, Custer. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen in some portions of the advised area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Hennessey, Okeene, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Canton, Custer City, Longdale, Hitchcock, Greenfield, Loyal, Oakwood, Eagle City, Fay, southeastern Canton Lake, Southard and Omega. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
